results.title: Learning English : it's harder than you think (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Ethnic Affairs Division and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: An Australian looks at the problems faced by migrants in learning to speak English. Through his investigation we learn that they face many problems: pressures of finding work as soon as they arrive, difficulties in finding classes that don’t conflict with work hours, working in jobs where there is little communication with others. Isolation restricts their practice of language

results.title: High country
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Geoff Burrowes and Yenan Productions
results.brief_description: A group of amateur horsemen cross Victoria’s Great Dividing Range using a little frequented track. Shows without commentary, the grandeur and mystique of the region. Music by Mario Mills and Jon English

results.title: Make Believe Play (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School Series No.4”.
Shows children’s play with paint, crayons, scrap, collage and dressing-up materials, that involves children in making and pretending. It shows the development from spontaneous play to a structured play situation

results.title: The Last coastline
results.creator_credit: G Turney-Smith, Jack Hume, South Australian Film Corporation and Arkaba Films
results.brief_description: In 1802, Captain Matthew Flinders explored and charted the last unknown coastline on Earth. We see this magnificent coastline as Flinders saw it, recreating his journey with the help of the record in his ship’s log. The coastline is that of Eyre Peninsula, South Australia - a coastline that has been barely touched by man. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Leaf
results.brief_description: Captures the spirit of Autumn in the wilderness, by blending the elements of wind and leaf in a visually and rhythmically enchanting study of California’s Yosemite valley.

results.title: A Pace ahead
results.creator_credit: Lilias Castle, Norman Castle and Australian Dairy Board
results.brief_description: Research is the basis for new and improved products from the dairy industry. Experimental farms test new breeds of cattle, pastures and fodder harvesting and conservation. Shows milk production, butter making, cheese making, and the by-products of casein and malt, and considers the nearby eastern countries as a tremendous market.

results.title: The Other Face of the Island
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Norman Laird, Tasfilm Productions and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Using special cinematograph effects such as split screens, this film sets up a storyline to promote the resources and industries of Tasmania. The main products and secondary industries are grouped broadly into wool and textiles, including carpets; paper; processed food; and metal products. The cast includes four Australian models - Wendy Gilmore, Nola Clark, Carol Stevens and Barbara Wilding - outfitted by Prue Acton.

results.title: On the ball (1st Version)
results.brief_description: A humorous commentary on the game of Australian football. Go there, see it all. The screams, the advice, friendly admonitions. An analysis of the various aspects of Australian Rules Football spectatorship.

results.title: Om and Prom from Cambodia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friends”.
A day in the life of two Cambodian boys. Shows them at school, at play, at home and working in the rice fields. They ride on elephants to the ruins of Angkor where they see the age-old ritual of the beautiful palace dancers.

results.title: Not by choice
results.brief_description: A glimpse of Sydney’s soup-kitchens and the down-and-outs for whom they provide meals. This documentary film gives a glimpse of the institutions and of the lives of the men they assist. Its frankly emotional approach avoids any attempt to explain causes or to offer solutions. In fact it suggests that strong personal pride is characteristic of these men, and would prohibit any easy solution.
